title: How can one start a bakery? - Quora

response.answer_text: Figure out who buys from bakeries. Who buys from bakeries: commuters, stay-at-home parents, retirees, restaurants, etc. Figure out if they’ll buy from you. One by one, figure out why they buy and if they’ll buy from you. If not, figure out how to make your offering so compelling that they’ll buy. Start selling. Make samples, pound pavement and sell. Setup a stand. Sell via social media. Sell to small businesses. Just bring samples and sell order. Then Bake. I’m not talking about renting a space, leasing commercial ovens, staffing, etc. Use your kitchen, your neighbors and friends’ kitchens, buy from wherever you can get stuff NOW and start baking. Start Learning. Now that you know how to acquire customers, the amount of work involved, what you can charge and what things cost, you have a baseline. You know what your costs are, what you’d need to scale, and if you have the customers to support that growth (and if not, how to acquire them). That’s a great baseline. Estimate. Make informed decisions about how changing certain parameters impact your business. How does increasing production affect fixed and variable costs? How does foot traffic in a location affect sales (do comps against competitors)? How can you acquire new customers (paid / unpaid)? How much can you afford to invest? Make a plan. You can change it often and you don’t even have to write it down. But, you should always know what your next move is and have line of sight into your next 5–10 moves. Get Started. Good luck!
